unnormalised: Hey everyone! I've been diving deeper into yoga recently, and it's seriously impacting my lifestyle and overall wellness in such a positive way. I wanted to share some of my experiences and maybe spark some inspiration for others!
normalised: Hey everyone! I've been diving deeper into yoga recently, and it's seriously impacting my lifestyle and overall wellness in such a positive way. I wanted to share some of my experiences and maybe spark some inspiration for others!

unnormalised: Growing up in Mumbai, I always saw people heading to yoga classes early in the morning. My Dadi, Nirmala Devi, swears by her daily Surya Namaskar. She's 85 and still incredibly active! It definitely piqued my interest.
normalised: Growing up in Mumbai, I always saw people heading to yoga classes early in the morning. My Dadi, Nirmala Devi, swears by her daily Surya Namaskar. She's eighty five and still incredibly active! It definitely piqued my interest.

unnormalised: I started with Hatha yoga classes at a studio near my house, a cozy little place about 500 sq ft. The instructor, Dr. Sharma, is amazing. He emphasizes proper alignment and breathing techniques, which makes a huge difference. Now, I try to incorporate some form of yoga practice into my routine almost every day. Some days it's a full hour session, other days just 15 minutes of mindful stretching.
normalised: I started with Hatha yoga classes at a studio near my house, a cozy little place about five hundred square feet. The instructor, Doctor Sharma, is amazing. Some days it's a full hour session, other days just fifteen minutes of mindful stretching.

unnormalised: I've noticed a significant reduction in my stress levels, improved flexibility, and even better sleep. Plus, it’s a fantastic way to connect with my body and mind.
normalised: I've noticed a significant reduction in my stress levels, improved flexibility, and even better sleep. Plus, it’s a fantastic way to connect with my body and mind.

unnormalised: Has anyone else experienced similar benefits from yoga? I'm also curious about different styles. I've heard good things about Iyengar yoga and Ashtanga. Any recommendations for a good Ashtanga studio in Bangalore? (Planning a trip soon!). Also, what's a reasonable monthly fee for yoga classes these days? I’m currently paying Rs. 2500, is that the norm? Share your thoughts and experiences! It’s amazing how ancient Indian practices are still so relevant and beneficial today.
